Title: 'The Last Airbender' Trailer 2 HD
Comment: I know there has been a lot of criticism about this movie, but I really liked it.  Having never seen nor heard of the Airbender cartoons, I didn't have any idea how the story was "supposed" to be.  I was so hoping, since the film ended on a cliff hanger that there would be at least 2 more films, so that one could know the "rest of the story". I've heard talk that Airbender2 is in the works but that it will be a while before it will be released.  I really liked the original cast, but I kinda doubt that the same people would be used again, simply because of the amount of time since the last pictures was made.

BASICALLY EVERYTHING BECAUSE YOU'RE IN SUCH A GOOD MOOD AND CAN'T WAIT BECAUSE THE OF THE TRAILER, HAND THE GUY A 50 AND TELL HIM TO KEEP THE CHANGE BECAUSE OF HOW HAPPY YOU ARE THAT YOU'RE BELOVED SHOW IS FINALLY ON THE SCREENS WITH AN EPIC TRAILER, BUT THEN YOU ACTUALLY GO TO THE MOVIE.. AND YOU REALISE THAT IT'S ACTUALLY AN INSULT TO YOUR BELOVED SHOW, IT LITERALLY TEARS YOU APART FROM PIECE TO PIECE, AND IT LITERALLY DEPRESSES YOU, YOU HAVE TO SIT THROUGH 2 WHOLE HOURS OF PURE SADNESS, IT RUINS YOUR DAY, IT RUINS YOUR WEEK, IT RUINS YOUR MONTH, IT RUINS YOUR YEAR, HECK IT RUINS A PART OF YOUR LIFE EVERY TIME YOU REMEMBER IT WONDERING HOW SOMETHING THAT SEEMED SO GOOD COULD BE SO BAAAD??. I HOPE THE DERANGED MADMAN THAT EVER HAD THE NERVE TO EVEN THINK OF THIS INSULT IS AWARE OF THE SCALE OF HIS MISTAKE.. BUT THAT'S IMPOSSIBLE SINCE THIS IS HORRIBLY BAD BEYOND ANY MEASURE. LIKE WHY IS ZUKO BLOODY INDIAN? WHY IS THE FIREBENDING SO BAD? WHY DOES THE FIRELORD LOOK WRONG IN EVERY POSSIBLE WAY?, HE LITERALLY LOOKS WRONG IN EVERY POSSIBLE WAY? WHY ARE KATARA AND SOKKA THE WRONG ETHNICITIES? HECK WHY'S EVEN THE BLUE SPIRIT MASK COMPLETELY WRONG?? WHY?? A MASK??? IT WAS ONLY A MASK!!! WHY IS EVERYTHING SO SHITTY??!! WHY, OH WHY, OH WHY!!!!!!! GOD DAMN YOU M.NIGHT SHYAMALAN!

So in conclusion Heavens Gate BOMED IN THE BOX OFFICE, and Michael Cimino's career was over. I think some parts of the movie were better than the series. Most notably:
-The Fire nation ships. They're much more awesome in the movie
-The end battle, where Aang forces the fleet away with a huge wave. Much better than glowy watery thingy.
-the part where he discovers the monks, and goes into the avatar state.

Title: 'The Last Airbender' Trailer 2 HD
Comment:
The biggest problem this move had was trying to sqeeze in too much into too little time.

The Last Airbender series was this sprawling epic that took palce over months with dozens of characters and stories.

You cannot take all that and then cram it into a comparitively short amount of screentime and expect it to work.

As much as I might want for this movie to have been a success, I have to admit to myself that this story could only have worked as a TV series where it has the time it needs.

The movie is nothing like the cartoon.

6.They never go to Omashu or with King Bumi
7.Aang never talks to a dragon
8.They dont mention the Winter Solstice

They tried to stuff too many of the plots from the animated series into too short a period of time, while trying to add more stuff on top.

Maybe they can get a writer and director for the next one. I think that cast have more potential than was shown.

Title: 'The Last Airbender' Trailer 2 HD
Comment: The film so far has received almost universally negative reviews, earning an 7% score on Rotten Tomatoes. Despite flashy special effects, The Last Airbender squanders the potential of its popular source material on an incomprehensible plot, laughable dialogue, and a joyless sense of detachment. Roger Ebert gave the film half a star in his review, stating that it "bores and alienates its audiences," and notes the poor use of 3D among the film's faults.

Title: 'The Last Airbender' Trailer 2 HD
Comment:
@MyWhiteWings No, it's not originally Japanese. I suggest you look it up. The series was created by two American men (Michael Dante DiMartino and Bryan Konietzko), and originally aired on an American network (Nickelodeon).

Therefore, it is not anime. The word "cartoon" in the most modern sense refers to animation with little or no story line and humour without drama. Since Avatar is primarily dramatic and humorous storytelling, it's an animated series and not a "cartoon".

@MrOmniblast The first film adaptation of X-Men was also an interpretation, as was the first screening of "Gulliver's Travels" If you want the best example ever, you should see the movie "Adaptation," which is a genius interpretation of "The Orchid Thief" by Susan Orlean.
 Change in adaptation of a story from book or TV to film is essential and practically unavoidable, mandated both by the constraints of time and medium, but how much is always a balance.

Title: 'The Last Airbender' Trailer 2 HD
Comment: @MrOmniblast "The Dark Night" was a new spin on Batman, and the Broadway version of "The Lion King" was a phenomenal success. West Side Story, an interpretation of Romeo and Juliet, and 10 Things I Hate About You, an adaptation of The Taming of the Shrew, are also both great examples of setting something classic in a new atmosphere. While it is possible to adapt something to film and keep it exactly the same, it can also be great to put a new spin on something.

Fire: China

av·a·tar  (v-tär)
n.

Title: 'The Last Airbender' Trailer 2 HD
Comment:
Now that I think about it, Superman isn't American... he's Kryptonian.

But the story did require that in order to maintain his secret identity, he had to pass off as a farm boy from Kansas.  If he had landed in Tokyo instead of Smallville, then he probably would've needed to look Asian.

The ethncity of the actors in Avatar, on the other, don't really affect the plot.  The Avatar world is meant as a fantasy one, which is why we're saying "influenced" instead of "directly based".

Title: 'The Last Airbender' Trailer 2 HD
Comment: Wow, that may be true, but have you not watched the cartoon? It is heavily implied that these characters are asian. The story is built up on Asian mythology and the cartoon borrows from Asian art. Traditional East Asian calligraphy styles are used for nearly all the writing in the show. The shows influences include Chinese art and history, Buddism and Taoism. Although I don't believe Shyamalan intended this to be racist and I don't think it's racist, the characters would make sense to be asian.
